page.title: 02WILSTEAD VILLAGE
page.content: Wilstead was probably an Anglo-Saxon agricultural settlement based on the fertile Bedfordshire clay soils. Today Wilstead is a fairly large village with ample shops and services for local needs. The older village was linear in form and used to be cut in two by the A6. However a large modern post war housing estate has been established hiding the original linear form. The village is now by-passed by the A6. Although the village has shops and services the local people mainly shop in Bedford for major goods. Wilstead is a fairly large village with five public houses, a garage and a few shops situated about five miles from Bedford.
